intro: Johrenia platycarpa, commonly known as the broad-fruited johrenia, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds, a feature typical of many members of its family. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
